decks.notes: This Dimir Control deck focuses on maintaining board control through a combination of counter spells, removal spells, and card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also utilizing counterspells like Force of Negation and Counterspell to protect its own threats. By utilizing efficient card draw with Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and filtering with Preordain, the deck aims to outvalue opponents and grind them out in a long game. Murktide Regent provides a strong threat to close out the game once control has been established.

The deck focuses on efficiently ramping up mana with land cards such as Simic Growth Chamber and Lotus Field to quickly cast Primeval Titan. The key strategy involves using Amulet of Vigor to untap lands for additional activations, allowing for explosive plays like Scapeshift to search for multiple lands and deal significant damage. The deck also utilizes cards like Urza's Saga and Aftermath Analyst to generate additional value and card advantage. Overall, the goal is to assemble powerful combinations of lands and spells to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble a combo without relying on traditional lands. By utilizing cards like Lotus Bloom and Whir of Invention, the deck aims to achieve a game-winning play through a combination of spells and abilities. Thundertrap Trainer and Tameshi, Reality Architect are key components in setting up the combo, while cards like Sea Gate Restoration and Hydroelectric Specimen provide additional support. The deck also includes disruption and protection spells like Spell Snare and Force of Negation to ensure the combo goes off successfully. Ultimately, the goal is to win the game using cards like Goblin Charbelcher.

This combo deck utilizes Allosaurus Rider and Neoform to search for and play Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant as early as turn two, creating a powerful and explosive board presence. The deck also includes other utility creatures such as Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to provide additional value and support the combo strategy. Glittering Wish allows for versatile sideboard options to combat different matchups, while Consign to Memory provides card draw and disruption. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive and efficient creatures.

The deck focuses on using creatures with high mana costs and powerful abilities to control the game until the player can cast Living End to bring all creatures back from the graveyard, overwhelming the opponent with a strong board presence. The deck also includes cards that can disrupt opponents' strategies and protect its own creatures. By carefully managing resources and timing the Living End, the deck aims to quickly shift the game in its favor and secure a win.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while quickly deploying threats on the board. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt the opponent's hand and graveyard, combined with efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude, it aims to control the game tempo. At the same time, it utilizes aggressive creatures like Ketramose, the New Dawn and Emperor of Bones to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. The addition of disruptive creatures like Flickerwisp and Witch Enchanter further adds to the deck's versatility and disruption capabilities.
